head.supplied: ¶ [Govt Botanist Reqn for 10,000 labels] ¶ M's requisition would almost certainly have been rejected, given the Government's decision, of which M had been informed a few days earlier (seeM to A. McLe...

div.p: No. 114, vol. 1892 T, VPRS 1168/P inward correspondence registers,VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found; item is a register entry only, of arequisitiondated 4 January 1892.
[Govt Botanist Reqn for 10,000 labels]
M's requisition would almost certainly have been rejected, given the Government's decision, of which M had been informed a few days earlier (seeM to A. McLean, 1 January 1892), that the position of Government Botanist was to be abolished. (The fate of the Government Herbarium was still under discussion; see T. Wilson to M, 15 January 1892.)However, M's position was continueduntil 31 December 1892(seeT. Wilson to M, 31 March 1892)and further labels printed later in the year after M knew that he had been awarded an Honorary LLD by McGill University (see McGill University to M, 30 April 1892). listing hisqualificationsas'Ph. & M.D LL.D' (see for example, the label on a Poa species, MEL 9369).
